intro: Peucedanum sikkimense, commonly known as Sikkim angelica, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal, India, and Bhutan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in mountainous areas with rich soil. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
